### source 2 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER IX*

* Header 3: Section 3

* Header 5: Article 273
:

 extract:

 1. Insurance and reinsurance undertakings shall establish, implement and maintain documented policies and adequate
procedures to ensure that all persons who effectively run the undertaking or have other key functions are at all times fit
and proper within the meaning of Article 42 of Directive 2009/138/EC.


2. The assessment of whether a person is fit shall include an assessment of the person's professional and formal
qualifications, knowledge and relevant experience within the insurance sector, other financial sectors or other businesses
and shall take into account the respective duties allocated to that person and, where relevant, the insurance, financial,
accounting, actuarial and management skills of the person.

 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 2: DIRECTIVES
:

 extract:

 (30) The system of governance includes the risk-management
function, the compliance function, the internal audit func­
tion and the actuarial function.


(31) A function is an administrative capacity to undertake par­
ticular governance tasks. The identification of a particular
function does not prevent the undertaking from freely
deciding how to organise that function in practice save
where otherwise specified in this Directive. This should not
lead to unduly burdensome requirements because account
should be taken of the nature, scale and complexity of the
operations of the undertaking. It should therefore be pos­
sible for those functions to be staffed by own staff, to rely
on advice from outside experts or to be outsourced to
experts within the limits set by this Directive.

 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 2: DIRECTIVES

 (32) Furthermore, save as regards the internal audit function, in
smaller and less complex undertakings it should be pos­
sible for more than one function to be carried out by a
single person or organisational unit.


(33) The functions included in the system of governance are
considered to be key functions and consequently also
important and critical functions.


(34) All persons that perform key functions should be fit and
proper. However, only the key function holders should be
subject to notification requirements to the supervisory

## Answer
        

 When answering reference ONLY if applicable source with (Source <insert number>). Answer based on the mentioned sources in the Context answer the Question.

Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen worden de verschillende sleutelfuncties (key functions) onder de Solvency II-wetgeving genoemd in de overwegingen (recitals) van Richtlijn 2009/138/EC.

De specifieke functies worden opgesomd in overweging (30) van Richtlijn 2009/138/EC:
*   De risicobeheerfunctie (risk-management function)
*   De compliancefunctie (compliance function)
*   De interne auditfunctie (internal audit function)
*   De actuariële functie (actuarial function) (Source 4)

Overweging (33) van dezelfde richtlijn bevestigt dat deze functies als sleutelfuncties worden beschouwd (Source 5).

Daarnaast verwijzen de bronnen naar Artikel 42 van Richtlijn 2009/138/EC in de context van de "fit and proper" eisen die gelden voor de personen die deze sleutelfuncties bekleden (Source 2, Source 3).

## Answer
        

 When answering reference ONLY if applicable source with (Source <insert number>). Answer based on the mentioned sources in the Context answer the Question.

Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen worden de kerntaken van de sleutelfunctiehouders op een algemeen niveau beschreven. De bronnen specificeren niet de gedetailleerde taken voor elke afzonderlijke functie (risicobeheer, compliance, interne audit en actuariële functie), maar geven wel een overkoepelend beeld van hun rol.

De kerntaken van de sleutelfuncties zijn:
*   Het uitvoeren van hun specifieke taken, waarvoor zij de benodigde autoriteit, middelen en operationele onafhankelijkheid moeten hebben.
*   Het rapporteren aan en adviseren van het bestuurs-, leidinggevend of toezichthoudend orgaan van de verzekerings- of herverzekeringsonderneming (Source 4).

De overige bronnen benadrukken voornamelijk de vereisten waaraan de sleutelfunctiehouders moeten voldoen, zoals de "fit and proper" eisen, en de rapportageverplichtingen over deze functies, in plaats van een gedetailleerde lijst van hun taken (Source 2, Source 3, Source 5).
